articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks forged deeper into eastern Rafah, reaching some residential districts on Tuesday, stepping up an offensive in the southern border city where more than a million people had been sheltering after being displaced in seven months of war.
articles.title: Israeli tanks push into Gaza's Rafah, as displaced civilians flee again

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi, Ivan Lyubysh-Kirdey, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Ukraine's military said on Tuesday its forces pulled back to new positions in two areas of the northeastern Kharkiv region where Moscow is pressing an offensive, and warned of a Russian force buildup to the north near its Sumy region.
articles.title: Ukraine pulls back in two areas of Kharkiv region, warns of buildup near Sumy region

articles.author: Greg Torode, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's Beijing visit on Thursday is likely to be light on hard deals but will mark the start of his new presidential term with a show of support from his most powerful political partner, Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping.
articles.title: Defying West, Russia's Putin due to meet Xi Jinping in Beijing

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Kyiv on Tuesday in the first visit to Ukraine by a senior U.S. official since Congress passed a long-delayed $61 billion military aid package for the country last month.
articles.title: Blinken arrives in Ukraine in show of US solidarity amid Russian attacks

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: North Korea laundered $147.5 million through virtual currency platform Tornado Cash in March after stealing it last year from a cryptocurrency exchange, according to confidential work by United Nations sanctions monitors seen by Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Exclusive: North Korea laundered $147.5 mln in stolen crypto in March, say UN experts

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: Georgia's parliament on Tuesday passed the third and final reading of a "foreign agents" bill, prompting a warning from the United States that if the legislation failed to meet European Union standards, Washington could review relations.
articles.title: Georgian parliament passes 'foreign agent' bill, prompting US anger, new protests

articles.author: David Ljunggren, Nia Williams
articles.description: A large wildfire is slowly approaching the major Canadian oil sands city of Fort McMurray and around 6,000 people in four suburbs have been told to evacuate, local officials said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Canada's oil sands hub threatened by wildfire, sparking large evacuations

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: The intense northern hemisphere summer heat that drove wildfires across the Mediterranean, buckled roads in Texas and strained power grids in China last year made it not just the warmest summer on record - but the warmest in some 2,000 years, new research suggests.
articles.title: Summer 2023 was the hottest in 2,000 years, study says

articles.author: Jan Strupczewski
articles.description: France and the Netherlands are seeking European Union sanctions on any financial institution in the world that helps Russia's military pay for goods or technology for making weapons, according to a proposal seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: French, Dutch seek EU sanctions on financial institutions helping Russia military

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Islamic State claimed responsibility on Tuesday for an attack on Monday targeting an army post in northern Iraq which security sources said had killed a commanding officer and four soldiers.
articles.title: Islamic State claims attack on army post in northern Iraq
